title: Trump Accounts - Federal Savings Program Named After President
summary: Trump administration created 'Trump Accounts' - tax-advantaged savings accounts for children with federal government seeding $1,000 for babies born 2025-2028. IRS created official website TrumpAccounts.gov. Program embedded Trump's personal branding into federal tax system and retirement savings infrastructure. Michael Dell donated $1 million in 'landmark' promotion. Available through major brokerages like Vanguard, Schwab, Fidelity. Critics noted unprecedented naming of federal program after sitting president.
keyFacts: Trump administration created 'Trump Accounts' through One Big Beautiful Bill Act
Federal government seeds $1,000 for every child born 2025-2028 who are U.S. citizens
IRS Form 4547 created specifically for Trump Accounts
Money grows tax-deferred in U.S. stock index funds until child turns 18
Annual contribution limit of $5,000 until beneficiary reaches 18
White House press release: 'Landmark Dell Gift Supercharges Trump Accounts'
Available through Vanguard, Charles Schwab, Fidelity
Trump's name embedded in federal tax code and retirement savings system
Unprecedented naming of major federal program after sitting president
